main_definition: Speed is the rate at which an object covers distance, indicating how fast or slow something moves.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical velocity of a moving body
meanings_and_examples.example: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.

meanings_and_examples.definition: How quickly information or data can be processed or transmitted
meanings_and_examples.example: Online streaming services use high-speed internet to deliver content without buffering.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The pace at which a task, activity, or work is completed
meanings_and_examples.example: A carpenter who works with speed can finish building the entire house ahead of schedule.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Competitive racing and performance measurement in sports
meanings_and_examples.example: The sprinter broke the world record, achieving an astounding speed on the track.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Rapidly increasing or accelerating growth rate of something
meanings_and_examples.example: During a surge in demand, the company had to increase its production speed to meet orders.
